solution: AMELIORATE means to make something bad or unsatisfactory better. WORSEN means to make or become worse. They are direct opposites. Improve, Enhance, and Better are synonyms of Ameliorate.

title: Choose the SYNONYM of the word: UBIQUITOUS
solution: UBIQUITOUS means present, appearing, or found everywhere. OMNIPRESENT means widely or constantly encountered, present everywhere at the same time. Both words describe something found everywhere. Rare, Scarce, and Uncommon are antonyms.

title: Choose the ANTONYM of the word: MAGNANIMOUS
solution: MAGNANIMOUS means very generous or forgiving, especially toward a rival or less powerful person. PETTY means of little importance, narrow-minded. They are direct opposites in terms of generosity of spirit. Generous, Noble, and Forgiving are synonyms.

title: Choose the SYNONYM of the word: SYCOPHANT
solution: SYCOPHANT means a person who acts obsequiously toward someone important to gain advantage. FLATTERER means a person who lavishes praise, often insincerely. Both describe someone who praises excessively for personal gain. Critic, Opponent, and Detractor are antonyms.

title: Choose the ANTONYM of the word: TACITURN
solution: TACITURN means reserved or uncommunicative in speech, saying little. LOQUACIOUS means tending to talk a great deal, talkative. They are direct opposites. Silent, Reserved, and Reticent are synonyms of Taciturn.

title: Choose the SYNONYM of the word: PERFIDIOUS
solution: PERFIDIOUS means deceitful and untrustworthy. TREACHEROUS means guilty of or involving betrayal or deception. Both words describe someone who cannot be trusted and betrays others. Loyal, Faithful, and Trustworthy are antonyms.

title: Choose the ANTONYM of the word: OBDURATE
solution: OBDURATE means stubbornly refusing to change one's opinion or course of action. YIELDING means giving way to pressure, compliant. They are direct opposites. Stubborn, Inflexible, and Adamant are synonyms of Obdurate.

title: Choose the SYNONYM of the word: PERNICIOUS
solution: PERNICIOUS means having a harmful effect, especially in a gradual or subtle way. HARMFUL means causing or likely to cause harm. Both words describe something that causes damage or injury. Beneficial, Helpful, and Advantageous are antonyms.

title: Choose the ANTONYM of the word: PARSIMONIOUS
solution: PARSIMONIOUS means excessively unwilling to spend money or use resources, stingy. LAVISH means sumptuously rich or elaborate, spending freely. They are direct opposites. Frugal, Thrifty, and Miserly are synonyms of Parsimonious.

title: Choose the SYNONYM of the word: OSTRACIZE
solution: OSTRACIZE means to exclude someone from a society or group. EXCLUDE means to deny access to, keep out. Both words describe the act of keeping someone out of a group. Include, Welcome, and Accept are antonyms.

title: Choose the ANTONYM of the word: CACOPHONY
solution: CACOPHONY means a harsh, discordant mixture of sounds. HARMONY means the combination of simultaneously sounded musical notes to produce a pleasing effect. They are direct opposites. Discord, Noise, and Din are synonyms of Cacophony.

title: Choose the SYNONYM of the word: ENERVATE
solution: ENERVATE means to cause someone to feel drained of energy or vitality. WEAKEN means to make or become weaker. Both words describe a reduction in strength or energy. Energize, Strengthen, and Invigorate are antonyms.

title: Choose the ANTONYM of the word: EBULLIENT
solution: EBULLIENT means cheerful and full of energy, enthusiastically excited. SUBDUED means quiet and rather reflective or depressed. They are direct opposites. Enthusiastic, Exuberant, and Vivacious are synonyms of Ebullient.

title: Choose the SYNONYM of the word: RECALCITRANT
solution: RECALCITRANT means having an obstinately uncooperative attitude toward authority. DEFIANT means showing resistance and bold disobedience. Both words describe refusing to comply with rules or authority. Obedient, Compliant, and Submissive are antonyms.

title: Choose the ANTONYM of the word: ABSTRUSE
solution: ABSTRUSE means difficult to understand, obscure. OBVIOUS means easily perceived or understood, clear. They are direct opposites. Obscure, Complex, and Esoteric are synonyms of Abstruse, all meaning difficult to comprehend.

title: Choose the one word for: 'A person who loves books and reading'
solution: BIBLIOPHILE is derived from Greek 'biblion' (book) and 'philos' (loving). It means a person who loves and collects books. Bibliophobe is one who fears books, Calligrapher is one who does beautiful handwriting, and Lexicographer is one who compiles dictionaries.

title: Choose the one word for: 'A person who can speak two languages fluently'
solution: BILINGUAL means able to speak two languages fluently. 'Bi' means two and 'lingual' relates to language. Polyglot is one who speaks many languages, Linguist is an expert in languages, and Monolingual is one who speaks only one language.

title: Choose the one word for: 'A person who eats human flesh'
solution: CANNIBAL refers to a person who eats human flesh. Carnivore is an animal that eats meat, Herbivore eats plants, and Omnivore eats both plants and meat. Cannibal specifically refers to the consumption of one's own species.

title: Choose the one word for: 'Government by the wealthy or rule by the rich'
solution: PLUTOCRACY is derived from Greek 'ploutos' (wealth) and 'kratos' (power/rule). It means government by the wealthy. Democracy is rule by the people, Aristocracy is rule by the nobility, and Theocracy is rule by religious leaders.

title: Choose the one word for: 'The killing of one's own father'
solution: PATRICIDE means the killing of one's own father. It comes from Latin 'pater' (father) and 'cide' (killing). Matricide is killing one's mother, Fratricide is killing one's brother or sister, and Homicide is killing any human being.

title: Choose the one word for: 'A place where birds are kept'
solution: AVIARY is a large enclosure for keeping birds. It comes from Latin 'avis' (bird). Aquarium is for fish and aquatic animals, Apiary is a place where bees are kept, and Sanctuary is a protected area for wildlife in general.

title: Choose the one word for: 'One who walks in sleep'
solution: SOMNAMBULIST is a person who walks in their sleep. It comes from Latin 'somnus' (sleep) and 'ambulare' (to walk). Insomniac is one who cannot sleep, Narcissist is one who loves oneself excessively, and Hypochondriac is one obsessed with imaginary illnesses.

title: Choose the one word for: 'Something that cannot be imitated or copied'
solution: INIMITABLE means so good or unusual as to be impossible to copy. It comes from Latin 'in' (not) and 'imitare' (to imitate). Indelible means cannot be erased, Inevitable means cannot be avoided, and Infallible means incapable of making mistakes.

title: Choose the one word for: 'The practice of having many wives at the same time'
solution: POLYGYNY specifically means the practice of having more than one wife at the same time. It comes from Greek 'poly' (many) and 'gyne' (woman). Monogamy is having one spouse, Bigamy is having two spouses illegally, and Polyandry is having multiple husbands.

title: Choose the one word for: 'A word or practice that has gone out of use'
solution: OBSOLETE means no longer produced or used, out of date. While ARCHAIC means very old or old-fashioned, OBSOLETE specifically emphasizes that something is no longer in use or practice. Contemporary means modern, and Extinct refers to species that no longer exist.

title: In the sentence, 'The test was a piece of cake for her', the idiom 'a piece of cake' means:
solution: The idiom 'a piece of cake' is used to describe something that is very easy to do. It does not refer to importance, boredom, or confusion, but specifically to low difficulty.

title: I won't go out tonight; I'm feeling a bit _____ after working all day.
solution: The idiom 'under the weather' means feeling slightly ill or unwell. The other options describe being very happy or energetic, which does not match the context of feeling tired after working all day.

title: We were all strangers at first, but a few jokes helped to _____ and everyone started talking.
solution: The idiom 'break the ice' means to do or say something to make people feel more relaxed and willing to talk in a new or awkward situation. The other idioms have different meanings and do not fit the idea of encouraging conversation among strangers.

title: She lives abroad now and visits us only once in a blue moon. The idiom 'once in a blue moon' means:
solution: The idiom 'once in a blue moon' is used to describe something that happens very rarely. It is the opposite of happening frequently and has no connection with weekends or punctuality.

title: When you said that poor communication is our main problem, you really hit the nail on the head. The idiom 'hit the nail on the head' means:
solution: To 'hit the nail on the head' means to describe a situation or problem very accurately, especially by identifying the main cause. It does not mean making a mistake or changing the topic; it refers to being exactly right.

title: We have done enough for today; let's _____ and continue tomorrow.
solution: The idiom 'call it a day' means to stop working on something, usually because enough has been done for now. The other idioms refer to getting very angry, being stubborn, or changing opinions, which do not fit the idea of stopping work for the day.

title: He agreed to join the project at first but _____ at the last minute when he saw the schedule.
solution: The phrasal verb 'back out' means to withdraw from an agreement or commitment at the last moment. 'Broke down' usually refers to a machine stopping or a person crying; 'brought up' means mentioned; 'fell through' describes a plan that failed, not a person withdrawing.

title: As a general _____, you should always double-check the recipient's email address before sending important documents.
solution: A 'rule of thumb' is a practical general rule based on experience rather than strict theory. It fits the idea of a basic guideline. The other phrases refer to a cause of argument, a key moment of change, or a reasonable amount, which do not fit the context of general advice.

title: Before we start the project, I want to make sure everyone is on the same page. The phrase 'on the same page' means:
solution: To be 'on the same page' means that people share the same understanding or agree about what is being done. It is figurative and not literally about reading the same page of a document.

title: Don't worry, I'm just _____ your leg; I don't really expect you to finish all this work in one hour.
solution: The idiom 'pulling your leg' means to joke with someone or tease them in a friendly way. 'Breaking', 'kicking', or 'stretching' your leg do not form standard idioms in this context and would not match the playful tone.

title: I really _____ to meeting you in person at the conference next month.
solution: The phrasal verb 'look forward to' means to feel happy or excited about something that is going to happen in the future. 'Look up' means search for information, 'look into' means investigate, and 'look away' means turn your eyes from something, so they do not fit the positive anticipation in the sentence.

title: Even under extreme pressure, she managed to keep her cool. The idiom 'keep her cool' means:
solution: To 'keep one's cool' means to remain calm and not get upset or angry in a stressful situation. It does not involve pretending to be ill or speeding up work; it focuses on emotional control.

title: They submitted the assignment at the eleventh hour. Here, the phrase 'at the eleventh hour' means:
solution: 'At the eleventh hour' is an idiom that means doing something at the last possible moment, just before a deadline. It has nothing to do with the literal time eleven o'clock.

title: I've explained my position clearly; now the ball is in your court. The idiom 'the ball is in your court' means:
options: it is your turn to take action
solution: When 'the ball is in your court', it means it is now your responsibility or turn to take the next step or decision. It does not imply losing, stopping, or having to obey someone; it focuses on whose move it is next.

title: To finish the building faster, the contractor decided to cut corners. The idiom 'cut corners' means:
solution: To 'cut corners' means to save time or money by doing something in a cheaper, quicker, or less careful way, often sacrificing quality or rules. It does not mean adding care or improving skill; it usually has a negative sense.

title: While researching the topic, I _____ an old article that explained everything very clearly.
solution: The phrasal verb 'come across' means to find or encounter something by chance. 'Come over' means visit, 'come off' means succeed or detach, and 'come up' means arise as a topic or issue, so they do not match the idea of discovering an article while researching.

title: You should take his promises with a pinch of salt; he rarely keeps them. The idiom 'with a pinch of salt' means:
solution: To take something 'with a pinch of salt' means to be skeptical about it and not accept it as completely true. It suggests partial doubt, not full belief or total ignorance of the information.

title: Someone must have _____ the beans, because everyone already knew about the surprise party.
solution: The idiom 'spill the beans' means to reveal a secret, often by accident. In the context of a surprise party that everyone already knows about, 'spilled' correctly completes the idiom. The other verbs do not form a standard idiom with 'the beans' in this sense.

title: If you think I'm the one who deleted the files, you're barking up the wrong tree. The idiom 'barking up the wrong tree' means:
options: blaming the wrong person or thing
finding the right solution too late
solution: To 'bark up the wrong tree' means to direct your efforts or blame towards the wrong person or thing. It comes from hunting imagery and indicates a mistaken target, not simply being noisy or late.

title: After several failed attempts to fix the issue, the team decided to _____ and call a professional.
solution: The idiom 'throw in the towel' means to admit defeat or give up after trying. This fits the context of giving up and calling a professional. 'Jump the gun' means act too soon, 'hit the sack' means go to bed, and 'blow off steam' means release stress, so they do not match the idea of accepting failure.

title:
PASSAGE: Artificial Intelligence (AI) is transforming the way businesses operate across the globe. From automating routine tasks to providing deep insights through data analysis, AI has become an indispensable tool for modern enterprises. Companies are increasingly investing in AI technologies to gain a competitive edge in the market. Machine learning algorithms can now predict consumer behavior, optimize supply chains, and even detect fraudulent transactions in real-time. However, this rapid adoption of AI also raises concerns about job displacement. Many workers fear that automation will render their skills obsolete. Experts suggest that while AI will eliminate certain jobs, it will also create new opportunities in fields like AI development, data science, and robotics maintenance. The key lies in reskilling the workforce to adapt to this technological shift. Governments and educational institutions must collaborate to provide training programs that prepare workers for the jobs of tomorrow. The transition may be challenging, but embracing AI is essential for economic growth and innovation.

QUESTION: What is the main idea of the passage?
options: AI will eliminate all jobs in the future
AI is transforming businesses but requires workforce adaptation
Companies should avoid investing in AI technologies
solution: The passage discusses how AI is transforming businesses and highlights both its benefits (automating tasks, providing insights, competitive advantage) and concerns (job displacement). It emphasizes that the key lies in reskilling the workforce, indicating that AI adoption requires workforce adaptation. This balanced view makes option B the main idea.

title:
PASSAGE: Climate change poses one of the greatest threats to global biodiversity. Rising temperatures and changing precipitation patterns are forcing countless species to migrate to new habitats or face extinction. Coral reefs, often called the rainforests of the sea, are particularly vulnerable. When ocean temperatures rise, corals expel the symbiotic algae living in their tissues, causing them to turn white—a phenomenon known as coral bleaching. Without these algae, corals lose their primary source of nutrition and become susceptible to disease. Scientists estimate that we have already lost nearly half of the world's coral reefs in the past three decades. The implications extend beyond marine ecosystems. Millions of people depend on coral reefs for food, coastal protection, and tourism revenue. Efforts to combat this crisis include establishing marine protected areas, reducing carbon emissions, and developing heat-resistant coral varieties through selective breeding. While these measures offer hope, experts warn that without drastic action to address climate change, the future of coral reefs remains uncertain.

QUESTION: What causes coral bleaching according to the passage?
options: Rising ocean temperatures causing corals to expel algae
solution: The passage clearly explains: 'When ocean temperatures rise, corals expel the symbiotic algae living in their tissues, causing them to turn white—a phenomenon known as coral bleaching.' This directly indicates that rising ocean temperatures cause corals to expel algae, resulting in bleaching.

title:
PASSAGE: The gig economy has fundamentally reshaped the traditional employment landscape. Platforms like Uber, Airbnb, and Fiverr have created opportunities for millions of workers to earn income on their own terms. Unlike conventional employment, gig work offers flexibility in terms of working hours, location, and the type of work undertaken. This model particularly appeals to millennials and Generation Z, who prioritize work-life balance over job security. However, this newfound freedom comes at a cost. Gig workers typically lack access to benefits that traditional employees enjoy, such as health insurance, paid leave, and retirement plans. The absence of a stable income can also create financial stress during periods of low demand. Critics argue that gig economy companies have shifted business risks onto workers while retaining the profits. In response, some governments have begun implementing regulations to protect gig workers' rights. California's Assembly Bill 5, for instance, requires companies to reclassify certain contractors as employees. The debate over how to balance innovation with worker protection continues to evolve as the gig economy expands.

QUESTION: Why does the gig economy particularly appeal to younger generations according to the passage?
options: They prefer higher salaries over flexibility
They prioritize work-life balance over job security
They want access to better health insurance
solution: The passage explicitly states: 'This model particularly appeals to millennials and Generation Z, who prioritize work-life balance over job security.' This directly indicates that younger generations are attracted to gig work because they value work-life balance more than traditional job security.

title:
PASSAGE: The discovery of CRISPR-Cas9 has revolutionized the field of genetic engineering. This molecular tool, derived from a bacterial defense mechanism, allows scientists to edit DNA with unprecedented precision. Unlike previous gene-editing techniques that were expensive and time-consuming, CRISPR is relatively affordable and accessible, democratizing genetic research. The potential applications are vast: from curing genetic diseases like sickle cell anemia and cystic fibrosis to developing drought-resistant crops that could address food security concerns. In 2020, Jennifer Doudna and Emmanuelle Charpentier were awarded the Nobel Prize in Chemistry for their pioneering work on CRISPR. However, the technology also raises profound ethical questions. The birth of gene-edited babies in China in 2018 sparked international outrage and highlighted the need for regulatory frameworks. Scientists worry about unintended mutations and the long-term consequences of altering human germline cells, which would pass modifications to future generations. The scientific community largely agrees that while CRISPR holds immense promise, its application, particularly in humans, must be governed by strict ethical guidelines and international consensus.

QUESTION: What makes CRISPR different from previous gene-editing techniques?
options: It is more expensive and complex
It is relatively affordable and accessible
It can only be used on plants
It was discovered in the 19th century
solution: The passage states: 'Unlike previous gene-editing techniques that were expensive and time-consuming, CRISPR is relatively affordable and accessible, democratizing genetic research.' This directly contrasts CRISPR with earlier methods, highlighting its affordability and accessibility as key differences.

title:
PASSAGE: Social media has become a double-edged sword in modern society. On one hand, platforms like Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram have connected billions of people across the globe, facilitating communication and information sharing at an unprecedented scale. Activists have leveraged these tools to organize movements, raise awareness about social injustices, and hold institutions accountable. The Arab Spring uprisings and the global Black Lives Matter movement exemplify the mobilizing power of social media. On the other hand, these platforms have also become breeding grounds for misinformation, cyberbullying, and political polarization. Algorithms designed to maximize user engagement often promote sensational and divisive content, creating echo chambers that reinforce existing beliefs. Studies have linked excessive social media use to increased rates of anxiety, depression, and loneliness, particularly among teenagers. The paradox is striking: tools designed to connect us may be driving us further apart. Addressing these challenges requires a multi-pronged approach involving platform accountability, digital literacy education, and individual mindfulness about consumption habits. The future of social media depends on our collective ability to harness its benefits while mitigating its harms.

QUESTION: What is meant by 'echo chambers' in the passage?
options: Sound recording studios used by musicians
Environments where one's existing beliefs are reinforced
solution: The passage states that algorithms 'promote sensational and divisive content, creating echo chambers that reinforce existing beliefs.' In this context, echo chambers refer to environments (online spaces) where people are exposed mainly to opinions and information that confirm their existing views, reinforcing their beliefs rather than challenging them.

title:
Rearrange the sentences to form a coherent paragraph:
A. He starts his day with a quick workout in the park.
B. After exercising, he takes a shower and has a healthy breakfast.
C. Rahul believes that following a routine helps him stay productive all day.
D. Every morning, Rahul wakes up at 5 a.m.
solution: D introduces the person and the daily habit: Rahul wakes up at 5 a.m. A logically follows as the first activity after waking up (a workout). B continues with the next step 'After exercising', linking back to A. C gives a general concluding statement about his belief regarding routines. So the correct order is D-A-B-C.

title:
Rearrange the sentences to form a coherent paragraph:
A. She browses different websites to compare prices and reviews.
B. Once she finds a good deal, she adds the item to her cart.
C. Finally, she completes the payment and waits for the delivery.
D. Before buying anything online, Neha makes a list of what she really needs.
solution: D is the natural starting point as it shows the first step: Neha makes a list before buying. A follows as she then browses websites. B comes next with the time marker 'Once she finds a good deal', and C concludes the sequence with 'Finally, she completes the payment'. Thus the logical order is D-A-B-C.

title:
Rearrange the sentences to form a coherent paragraph:
A. To support the cause, the students decided to organize a charity run.
B. The school library needed funds to buy new books for the students.
C. Many parents and teachers also joined the event and contributed generously.
D. As a result, the library was able to add several useful books to its collection.
solution: B presents the problem: the library needed funds. A logically follows as a response to this problem: students organize a charity run. C adds who participated and contributed to the event. D, starting with 'As a result', shows the outcome of this event. Hence the correct sequence is B-A-C-D.

title:
Rearrange the sentences to form a coherent paragraph:
A. First, it improves your vocabulary and language skills.
B. Second, it increases your knowledge about the world.
C. Reading books regularly has many benefits.
D. Finally, it helps you relax and reduce stress.
solution: C is the introductory sentence stating that reading has many benefits. A, B, and D then list those benefits in a logical, signposted order: 'First', 'Second', and 'Finally'. So the coherent flow is C-A-B-D.

title:
Rearrange the sentences to form a coherent paragraph:
A. However, he soon realized that he was not interested in coding at all.
B. After completing his degree in computer science, Arjun joined a software company.
C. Today, he runs a successful startup that helps students explore different career paths.
D. So, he decided to quit his job and pursue a career in career counseling.
solution: B is the starting point as it introduces Arjun's first job after his degree. A, beginning with 'However', contrasts with B by showing his lack of interest in coding. D, starting with 'So', naturally follows as a consequence of A. C then describes his present situation 'Today', which is the result of the decision in D. Thus the order is B-A-D-C.

title:
Rearrange the sentences to form a coherent paragraph:
A. As a result, she often missed deadlines and felt stressed.
B. At first, she would start working only a day before the due date.
C. Meera used to struggle with time management in college.
D. Later, she started planning her tasks in advance and using a daily schedule.
solution: C introduces Meera and the general problem with time management. B describes her initial habit 'At first'. A, starting with 'As a result', shows the consequence of B. D, with 'Later', indicates a change in her behavior to solve the problem. So the logical sequence is C-B-A-D.

title:
Rearrange the sentences to form a coherent paragraph:
A. On the other hand, excessive use of phones can reduce face-to-face interaction.
B. Mobile phones have become an essential part of our daily lives.
C. They allow us to stay connected, access information, and work from anywhere.
D. Therefore, it is important to use them wisely and maintain a healthy balance.
solution: B is the topic sentence introducing mobile phones as essential. C elaborates on the positive uses of phones. A, starting with 'On the other hand', presents the contrasting negative effect. D uses 'Therefore' to draw a conclusion from both positive and negative points. So the order is B-C-A-D.

title:
Rearrange the sentences to form a coherent paragraph:
A. This approach helped the team identify potential risks early.
B. The team first discussed the overall goal of the project.
C. Then, they broke the project into smaller tasks with specific deadlines.
D. As a result, they were able to finish the project on time and within budget.
solution: B introduces the initial step: discussing the overall goal. C naturally follows with 'Then', showing the next step of breaking the project into tasks. A explains the benefit of this approach. D, starting with 'As a result', states the final outcome. Hence the correct sequence is B-C-A-D.

title:
Rearrange the sentences to form a coherent paragraph:
A. Before every exam, Rohan feels very nervous and worries about failing.
B. To overcome this, he practises solving mock tests and revises regularly.
C. Over time, this practice has increased his confidence and reduced his anxiety.
D. Moreover, he has started meditating for a few minutes every morning.
solution: A presents Rohan's problem: feeling nervous before exams. B, with 'To overcome this', shows the first step he takes to solve it. D, starting with 'Moreover', adds an additional supportive habit. C, starting 'Over time', describes the combined effect of these practices. Thus the order is A-B-D-C.

title:
Rearrange the sentences to form a coherent paragraph:
A. In recent years, traffic congestion in big cities has become a serious problem.
B. Many people spend hours stuck in traffic jams every day.
C. To address this issue, governments are promoting public transport and carpooling.
D. If these measures are implemented effectively, city life can become more convenient.
solution: A is the opening sentence introducing traffic congestion as a serious problem. B explains the impact on people's lives. C, with 'To address this issue', proposes solutions. D looks ahead to the potential positive result 'If these measures are implemented effectively'. The logical order is A-B-C-D.

title:
Rearrange the sentences to form a coherent paragraph:
A. Initially, she found it difficult to adjust to the fast-paced environment.
B. Over time, she learned how to manage her tasks efficiently and communicate better.
C. As a result, she received positive feedback from her manager at the end of the internship.
D. Priya's first internship taught her several practical skills.
solution: D is the topic sentence introducing Priya's internship experience. A, with 'Initially', describes her early difficulty. B, starting 'Over time', shows her gradual improvement. C then concludes with the outcome 'As a result' of this learning. So the proper sequence is D-A-B-C.

title:
Rearrange the sentences to form a coherent paragraph:
A. Today, many young people prefer watching videos to reading books.
B. This shift in preference has reduced the habit of deep reading.
C. Earlier, reading was one of the most common forms of entertainment.
D. As a consequence, their ability to concentrate for long periods has also decreased.
solution: C contrasts the past situation 'Earlier' when reading was common. A then describes the current trend 'Today'. B, referring to 'This shift in preference', explains the effect on deep reading. D, starting with 'As a consequence', gives a further result concerning concentration. Hence the logical order is C-A-B-D.

title:
Rearrange the sentences to form a coherent paragraph:
A. Climate change is one of the most pressing challenges facing humanity today.
B. Industrial activities and the burning of fossil fuels are major sources of these gases.
C. Scientists warn that rising greenhouse gas emissions will lead to more extreme weather events.
D. These emissions trap heat in the atmosphere and disturb the Earth's climate system.
E. As a result, governments and organizations worldwide are working on strategies to reduce carbon footprints.
solution: A introduces the broad topic: climate change as a pressing challenge. B then specifies the human sources of greenhouse gases. D logically follows, with 'These emissions' referring back to the gases in B and explaining their effect. C adds scientists' warning about the consequences of rising emissions. E, starting with 'As a result', concludes with the global response. Thus, the coherent order is A-B-D-C-E.

title:
Rearrange the sentences to form a coherent paragraph:
A. After several failed experiments, she finally developed a product that solved a real customer problem.
B. At that point, she decided to leave her comfortable job and launch her own company.
C. Initially, Maya started working on her startup idea only during weekends and late nights.
D. With each setback, she improved the design based on user feedback.
E. Over the next few years, her company grew rapidly and attracted global investors.
solution: C is the starting point describing how Maya began working on her startup idea in her spare time. D follows, showing that with each setback she refined the design, indicating an iterative process. A then describes the turning point 'After several failed experiments' when she finally built a successful product. B, with 'At that point', refers back to this success and explains her decision to quit her job and formally launch the company. E concludes the story by describing the company's growth over the next few years. Therefore the correct order is C-D-A-B-E.

title:
Rearrange the sentences to form a coherent paragraph:
A. Many people now get their daily news updates from social media platforms.
B. However, this convenience also makes it easy for misinformation to spread quickly.
C. To tackle this, some platforms have introduced fact-checking labels and reporting tools.
D. As a result, users can access information within seconds without turning on the television.
E. Still, it is ultimately the responsibility of users to verify the information they consume.
solution: A introduces the trend of people getting news from social media. D, with 'As a result', explains the benefit: instant access to information. B, starting with 'However', contrasts this convenience with the risk of misinformation. C, 'To tackle this', mentions platform-level solutions like fact-checking tools. E, beginning with 'Still', emphasizes that despite these measures, users themselves must verify information. So the logical sequence is A-D-B-C-E.

title:
PASSAGE: Education is the cornerstone of personal and societal development. It __(1)__ individuals with the knowledge and skills necessary to navigate the complexities of modern life. A well-educated population contributes to economic growth, social stability, and technological innovation. However, access to quality education remains __(2)__ in many parts of the world. Millions of children, particularly girls and those in rural areas, are denied the opportunity to attend school. Governments and international organizations must work together to bridge this gap by investing in infrastructure, training teachers, and providing financial assistance to disadvantaged families.

Fill in blank (1):
solution: The passage discusses education as positive and essential for development. The blank needs a word that shows education provides something beneficial. 'Equips' means to provide with necessary items or skills, which fits perfectly. 'Deprives', 'confuses', and 'neglects' are all negative and contradict the positive context.

title:
PASSAGE: Education is the cornerstone of personal and societal development. It __(1)__ individuals with the knowledge and skills necessary to navigate the complexities of modern life. A well-educated population contributes to economic growth, social stability, and technological innovation. However, access to quality education remains __(2)__ in many parts of the world. Millions of children, particularly girls and those in rural areas, are denied the opportunity to attend school. Governments and international organizations must work together to bridge this gap by investing in infrastructure, training teachers, and providing financial assistance to disadvantaged families.

Fill in blank (2):
solution: The passage uses 'However' to introduce a contrast, indicating a problem. It then mentions millions of children being 'denied' education, especially girls and rural children. This indicates disparity in access. 'Unequal' fits perfectly as it describes the uneven distribution of educational access. 'Abundant', 'guaranteed', and 'universal' suggest positive situations, contradicting the context.

title:
PASSAGE: The rapid advancement of technology has transformed the healthcare industry in remarkable ways. Electronic health records have made patient information more __(1)__ to medical professionals, enabling faster and more accurate diagnoses. Telemedicine platforms allow patients in remote areas to consult with specialists without traveling long distances. Artificial intelligence is being used to analyze medical images and predict disease outbreaks. Despite these innovations, concerns about data __(2)__ persist. Patients worry that their sensitive medical information could be accessed by unauthorized parties or used for commercial purposes without their consent.

Fill in blank (1):
solution: The passage describes positive technological advancements in healthcare. Electronic health records are presented as beneficial, 'enabling faster and more accurate diagnoses.' For this to happen, patient information must be easy to access. 'Accessible' means easy to reach or use, fitting the positive context. 'Inaccessible', 'complicated', and 'restricted' would contradict the beneficial nature described.

title:
PASSAGE: The rapid advancement of technology has transformed the healthcare industry in remarkable ways. Electronic health records have made patient information more __(1)__ to medical professionals, enabling faster and more accurate diagnoses. Telemedicine platforms allow patients in remote areas to consult with specialists without traveling long distances. Artificial intelligence is being used to analyze medical images and predict disease outbreaks. Despite these innovations, concerns about data __(2)__ persist. Patients worry that their sensitive medical information could be accessed by unauthorized parties or used for commercial purposes without their consent.

Fill in blank (2):
solution: The passage shifts to concerns with 'Despite these innovations.' The following sentence mentions patients worrying about 'sensitive medical information' being 'accessed by unauthorized parties.' This clearly relates to privacy concerns. 'Data privacy' is a common collocation referring to protection of personal information. 'Creation', 'abundance', and 'simplicity' do not fit the context of unauthorized access concerns.

title:
PASSAGE: Climate change is no longer a distant threat but a present reality affecting communities worldwide. Rising sea levels threaten coastal cities, while __(1)__ weather events such as hurricanes, floods, and droughts are becoming more frequent and severe. Agricultural yields are declining in many regions, leading to food insecurity and economic hardship. Scientists emphasize that immediate action is necessary to __(2)__ the worst impacts of climate change. This includes transitioning to renewable energy sources, improving energy efficiency, and protecting natural carbon sinks like forests and wetlands.

Fill in blank (1):
solution: The passage discusses negative effects of climate change, listing 'hurricanes, floods, and droughts' as examples. These are severe weather phenomena. The word 'extreme' accurately describes such intense and dangerous weather events. 'Mild', 'pleasant', and 'ordinary' would contradict the severity implied by the examples and the overall alarming tone of the passage.

title:
PASSAGE: Climate change is no longer a distant threat but a present reality affecting communities worldwide. Rising sea levels threaten coastal cities, while __(1)__ weather events such as hurricanes, floods, and droughts are becoming more frequent and severe. Agricultural yields are declining in many regions, leading to food insecurity and economic hardship. Scientists emphasize that immediate action is necessary to __(2)__ the worst impacts of climate change. This includes transitioning to renewable energy sources, improving energy efficiency, and protecting natural carbon sinks like forests and wetlands.

Fill in blank (2):
solution: The passage calls for 'immediate action' to address climate change, followed by positive solutions like renewable energy and protecting forests. The blank requires a word meaning to reduce or lessen negative effects. 'Mitigate' means to make less severe or serious, fitting perfectly. 'Accelerate' and 'intensify' would mean making impacts worse, while 'ignore' contradicts the call for action.

title:
PASSAGE: The concept of work-life balance has gained significant attention in recent years as employees increasingly seek __(1)__ between their professional responsibilities and personal lives. Long working hours, constant connectivity through smartphones, and the pressure to meet deadlines have contributed to rising levels of stress and burnout. Progressive companies have responded by implementing flexible work arrangements, unlimited vacation policies, and wellness programs. Research shows that employees who maintain a healthy work-life balance are more __(2)__ and less likely to leave their jobs. Ultimately, prioritizing employee well-being is not just ethically sound but also makes good business sense.

Fill in blank (1):
solution: The passage discusses 'work-life balance,' which implies achieving a positive state between work and personal life. The word 'harmony' means a pleasing arrangement or agreement between parts, perfectly capturing what employees seek. 'Conflict', 'separation', and 'competition' suggest negative or divisive states that contradict the concept of balance.

title:
PASSAGE: The concept of work-life balance has gained significant attention in recent years as employees increasingly seek __(1)__ between their professional responsibilities and personal lives. Long working hours, constant connectivity through smartphones, and the pressure to meet deadlines have contributed to rising levels of stress and burnout. Progressive companies have responded by implementing flexible work arrangements, unlimited vacation policies, and wellness programs. Research shows that employees who maintain a healthy work-life balance are more __(2)__ and less likely to leave their jobs. Ultimately, prioritizing employee well-being is not just ethically sound but also makes good business sense.

Fill in blank (2):
solution: The passage presents work-life balance positively and states that it 'makes good business sense.' The sentence structure 'more __(2)__ and less likely to leave' suggests a positive outcome. 'Productive' is the only positive option that explains why work-life balance benefits businesses. 'Unproductive', 'dissatisfied', and 'absent' are negative and would contradict the passage's argument.

title:
PASSAGE: Artificial intelligence is rapidly reshaping the financial services industry. Banks and investment firms are deploying machine learning algorithms to detect fraudulent transactions, assess credit risk, and provide personalized financial advice to customers. These technologies can process vast amounts of data in milliseconds, identifying patterns that would be __(1)__ for human analysts to detect. However, the increasing reliance on AI also raises concerns about algorithmic bias. If the training data reflects historical inequalities, the AI systems may __(2)__ discriminatory practices, denying loans or services to certain demographic groups unfairly.

Fill in blank (1):
solution: The passage contrasts AI's ability to 'process vast amounts of data in milliseconds' with human capability. The sentence highlights AI's superiority in pattern detection. 'Impossible' indicates that humans cannot match AI's speed and accuracy in detecting these patterns. 'Easy', 'simple', and 'quick' would suggest humans could easily do this, contradicting the point about AI's advantage.

title:
PASSAGE: Artificial intelligence is rapidly reshaping the financial services industry. Banks and investment firms are deploying machine learning algorithms to detect fraudulent transactions, assess credit risk, and provide personalized financial advice to customers. These technologies can process vast amounts of data in milliseconds, identifying patterns that would be __(1)__ for human analysts to detect. However, the increasing reliance on AI also raises concerns about algorithmic bias. If the training data reflects historical inequalities, the AI systems may __(2)__ discriminatory practices, denying loans or services to certain demographic groups unfairly.

Fill in blank (2):
solution: The passage discusses a negative consequence: AI reflecting 'historical inequalities' from training data. The result is 'denying loans or services to certain demographic groups unfairly.' This means AI continues or maintains existing discrimination. 'Perpetuate' means to cause something to continue indefinitely, fitting the context of continuing discriminatory practices. 'Eliminate', 'expose', and 'correct' suggest positive actions against discrimination.

title:
PASSAGE: The preservation of indigenous languages is crucial for maintaining cultural diversity and heritage. Languages are not merely tools for communication; they embody unique worldviews, traditional knowledge, and historical memories. When a language dies, an __(1)__ repository of human wisdom is lost forever. Linguists estimate that nearly half of the world's approximately 7,000 languages are endangered and may disappear by the end of this century. Efforts to revitalize these languages include documentation projects, immersion schools, and digital archives. Community __(2)__ is essential for these initiatives to succeed, as language survival ultimately depends on whether younger generations choose to speak and transmit it.

Fill in blank (1):
solution: The passage emphasizes the importance of indigenous languages, stating they contain 'unique worldviews, traditional knowledge, and historical memories' and that something is 'lost forever' when a language dies. This indicates the loss is permanent and cannot be recovered. 'Irreplaceable' means impossible to replace, capturing the unique and unrecoverable nature. 'Insignificant', 'ordinary', and 'temporary' contradict the passage's emphasis on value and permanence.

title:
PASSAGE: The preservation of indigenous languages is crucial for maintaining cultural diversity and heritage. Languages are not merely tools for communication; they embody unique worldviews, traditional knowledge, and historical memories. When a language dies, an __(1)__ repository of human wisdom is lost forever. Linguists estimate that nearly half of the world's approximately 7,000 languages are endangered and may disappear by the end of this century. Efforts to revitalize these languages include documentation projects, immersion schools, and digital archives. Community __(2)__ is essential for these initiatives to succeed, as language survival ultimately depends on whether younger generations choose to speak and transmit it.

Fill in blank (2):
solution: The passage discusses efforts to save languages and emphasizes that success depends on 'younger generations choosing to speak and transmit it.' This requires active participation from the community. 'Involvement' means participation or engagement, which is necessary for revitalization efforts. 'Indifference', 'opposition', and 'isolation' suggest lack of participation or resistance, which would hinder language survival efforts.
